content:
the Observer is a studentrun daily print  online newspaper serving Notre Dame Saint Marys  Holy Cross PERIOD Learn about us PERIOD

Matt Gamber  Thursday April  

For the second straight year No PERIOD  Notre Dame couldnt handle No PERIOD  Vanderbilt despite coming off a big win over conference rival No PERIOD  Georgetown PERIOD

The Commodores   American Lacrosse Conference held the highpowered Irish   Big East attack in check for most of the game never trailing in their  victory at the Loftus Center Wednesday afternoon PERIOD Junior attack Jillian Byers led Notre Dame with three goals while senior Caitlin McKinney Alicia Billings and Shaylyn Blaney each scored single goals in the loss PERIOD

Notre Dame entered the game with a . goalspergame average and one of the nations top scorers in Byers but Vanderbilt goalkeeper Brooke Shinaberry continued her hot play saving more than  percent of the oppositions shots for the sixth time in seven games PERIOD

The Commodores got on the board by scoring the games first two goals in the opening five minutes before the Irish were able to knot the score at  PERIOD Vanderbilt scored twice to enter the half with a  advantage PERIOD

The visitors scored twice more for a  run and a  lead before Byers scored twice in a matter of minutes PERIOD The Commodores extended their lead to  before slowing the game down with a patient offense that spread the field and chewed the clock PERIOD Each team scored once more time to reach the final  tally PERIOD

Carter Foote scored three times to lead the Commodores who managed the victory despite losing the turnover battle  PERIOD

Last season a Notre Dame loss to Vanderbilt began a threegame slide from which the Irish never recovered PERIOD Coach Tracy Coynes squad will look to avoid that same fate beginning Sunday when the Irish travel to Piscataway N.J. to take on Rutgers PERIOD



Share This Story

Playing a team they had not beaten in the regular season for three years.. PERIOD
